intro: Solanum dasyanthum, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its berries, which are initially green and turn red when ripe, are edible but contain toxic compounds. Solanum dasyanthum belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
